message.content:
We must “net‐out” all the interest receivable entries. In our list every transaction whose type is Interest Receivables represents (in most cases) an increase in the interest receivable balance (except when a negative adjustment occurs). (In a cash‐flow statement an increase in an asset like interest receivable is “subtracted” and so the final “item” is shown with a minus sign.) 

Here is a way to work through the computation step‐by‐step:

1. Identify all the “Interest Receivables” transactions. (We list below with their “amount” values in the order found in our problem input.)  
  • Interest20240101001: +347.10  
  • Interest20240102002: +325.74  
  • Interest20240103003: +305.26  
  • Interest20240104004: +276.78  
  • Interest20240105005: +158.52  
  • Interest20240106006: +115.80  
  • Interest20240107007: +115.80  
  • Interest20240108008: +84.51  
  • Interest20240109009: +84.51  
  • Interest20240110010: +84.51  
  • Interest20240111011: +84.51  
  • Interest20240112012: +84.51  
  • Interest20240113013: +84.51  
  • Interest20240114014: +84.51  
  • Interest20240115015: +84.51  
  • Interest20240116016: +84.51  
  • Interest20240117017: –31.19  
  • Interest20240118018: +13.31  
  • Interest20240119019: +13.31  
  • Interest20240120020: +13.31  
  • Interest20240121021: +13.31  
  • Interest20240122022: +13.31  
  • Interest20240123023: +13.31  
  • Interest20240124024: +13.31  
  • Interest20240125025: +13.31  
  • Interest20240126026: +16.87  
  • Interest20240127027: +16.87  
  • Interest20240128028: +16.87  
  • Interest20240129029: +16.87  
  • Interest20240130030: +9.17  
  • Interest20240131031: +9.17  

2. Sum them in groups (rounding at two decimals):

 • Group1 (rows 1–4):  
  347.10 + 325.74 = 672.84;  
  672.84 + 305.26 = 978.10;  
  978.10 + 276.78 = 1254.88  

 • Group2 (rows 5–7):  
  158.52 + 115.80 + 115.80 = 390.12  
  Total so far: 1254.88 + 390.12 = 1645.00  

 • Group3 (rows 8–16): there are 9 entries each of 84.51 so 9 × 84.51 = 760.59  
  Total so far: 1645.00 + 760.59 = 2405.59  

 • Row17: –31.19 gives: 2405.59 – 31.19 = 2374.40  

 • Group4 (rows 18–25): 8 entries of 13.31 gives 8 × 13.31 = 106.48  
  Total now: 2374.40 + 106.48 = 2480.88  

 • Group5 (rows 26–29): 4 entries of 16.87 gives 4 × 16.87 = 67.48  
  Total now: 2480.88 + 67.48 = 2548.36  

 • Group6 (rows 30–31): 2 entries of 9.17 gives 2 × 9.17 = 18.34  
  Grand total: 2548.36 + 18.34 = 2566.70  

3. Interpretation: The interest receivable balance increased by 2566.70. In the cash flow statement an increase in an asset is “subtracted” – so the “(Increase) Decrease in Interest Receivable” item is reported as –2566.70.

Hence, the final answer is:

{
  "(Increase) Decrease in Interest Receivable": "-2566.70"
}

Below is the answer in the required JSON format. 

────────────────────────────
```json
{"solution": {"(Increase) Decrease in Interest Receivable": "-2566.70"} }
```
